column4: Hey guys ... E: Unable to lock the administration directory (/var/lib/dpkg/). How can I know which process is locking it?
ps aux | egrep "(apt|dpkg)"   -- its also possible that nothing is locking it and apt crashed.
I have a long list after issuing your command
You typed this exactly?  ps aux | egrep "(apt|dpkg)"
Ah, looks like dpkg is running in the background.  Do you have another terminal open that is running something?
the other terminal running has "top" running
just closed it and got the same results
Odd, it says its been running since december 11th.  Well. I guess you could kill the process and then run the fixapt instructions above.
It's a server I have in the cloud. I think I updated to ubuntu 11.10 that day
Are you sure it finished upgrading?  it says it is running in pts/2
not sure it finished updating. Shouldn't be finished by now?
It could be looking for your input
hold on... I saw a msg from it when I booted .. 1 sec
